channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: DoorDash’s stock pops on S&P 500 nod. Here’s who else is joining the index.
How a Copenhagen housing project by a $23 billion Novo-backed firm is rethinking big-city challenges like loneliness and access to sunlight
item.description: “If you want to address civilization and society's issues, then you have to do it with the city," Urban Partners' co-CEO Claus Mathisen said.

item.title: ChatGPT gets ‘anxiety’ from violent user inputs, so researchers are teaching the chatbot mindfulness techniques to ‘soothe’ it
item.description: A study on how to “calm down” chatbots could advance how AI is applied in mental health interventions, according to the authors.

item.title: Social Security to increase overpayment withholdings to 100% from 10%
It’s not 40 hours—Gen Z don’t know how long they need to work in a week and even experts can’t decide
item.description: Google cofounder Sergey Brin told Gemini staffers a 60-hour workweek is the “sweet spot”—but experts say that’s outrageous. The answer isn’t 40 hours,...

item.title: Most Americans don’t matter to the economy like they used to
Thinking of buying the stock-market dip? Here’s what you should know.
Gen Z students are rebelling against their parents’ Ivy League dream and choosing a different ideal university instead
item.description: MIT is students new No. 1 choice for college, but low acceptance rates and high tuition costs could kill that dream.

item.title: Stocks end higher on Powell remarks, but S&P 500 still posts worst week of 2025
FEMA cancels classes at national fire training academy amid federal funding cuts
item.description: "It’s not a ‘nice to have.’ It is the one avenue we have to bring people from all over the country to learn from and with each other."
